params.leafIndex: - the index of the leaf being added

returns.slot: - the index of the frontier (or 'storage slot') into which we will next store a nodeValue

params.leafValue: - the value of the leaf being inserted.

returns.root: - the root of the merkle tree, after the insert.

params.leafValues: - the values of the leaves being inserted.

returns.root: - the root of the merkle tree, after all the inserts.

NewLeaf(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: These events are what the merkle-tree microservice's filters will listen for.

getFrontierSlot(uint256).notice: Get the index of the frontier (or 'storage slot') into which we will next store a nodeValue (based on the leafIndex currently being inserted). See the top-level README for a detailed explanation.

insertLeaf(uint256).notice: Insert a leaf into the Merkle Tree, update the root, and update any values in the (persistently stored) frontier.

insertLeaves(uint256[]).notice: Insert multiple leaves into the Merkle Tree, and then update the root, and update any values in the (persistently stored) frontier.
